result.execSummary:
The defendant Harland C. H. Swenson Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12 [Modifiers: Persistent Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(b).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Persistent Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Persistent Repeater], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of $518.00 and witness fees of $290.00.  Bond to be applied.
Sentenced to life imprisonment without possibility of release under parole or extended supervision.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 12

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of $268.00.  Bond to be applied.

Sentenced to life imprisonment without possibility of release under parole or extended supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count 1

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: Pay costs of $268.00.  Bond to be applied.

Sentenced to life imprisonment without possibility of release under parole or extended supervision.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to counts 1 & 2

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

Defendant appears in person with Attorney Hammer by telephone.  Court modifies conditions of bond.

No contact with V.C.H., DOB 10-3-2003, or her residence.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON POSTING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Comply with GPS Unit through the Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant is confined to La Crosse County and Monroe County.
No unsupervised contact with any children under the age of 18 years old.
No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
Defendant is to be confined to his East Main Street address, may go to and from Bond Monitoring.  May go to and from meeting with his attorney if approved by Bond Monitoring program and to and from Northern Engraving if employed there.
Defendant is allowed to work at Habelman Cranberry Company.
Defendant may attend medical appointments that are verified in advance by the Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant may attend and participate at the Wisconsin Job Center in Tomah, Wisconsin.
Defendant may go to the home of Matthew Swenson on November 26, 2015 for a Thanksgiving celebration & December 24, 2015 for a Christmas celebration.
